headline: Ohio National Guard to provide support to Ukraine
author: WKYC Staff
sentences: The M-113 Armored Personnel Carriers that are being provided are used to move soldiers and equipment across the battlefield while providing protection from small arms fire and the effects of artillery.
"As we continue to learn about Russian war crimes in Ukraine, those of us in Ohio stand ready to help the Ukrainian people in any way possible," said Governor DeWine.
Last month, DeWine asked local and state law enforcement agencies to donate extra or expired personal protective gear that could be donated to Ukraine.
DeWine announced that the Ohio National Guard will provide aid in the form of armored personnel carriers to Ukraine for use against Russian aggression.
More than two dozen law enforcement agencies offered about 75 ballistic and riot helmets and 840 pieces of body armor, including vests and plates.
The governor said the state collected hundreds of donated helmets, protective vests and other supplies following the request.
Russian forces have recently increased their attacks on the city of Mariupol, which has become a key battleground in Ukraine.
OHIO, USA â€” Ohio Governor Mike DeWine is extending Ohio resources to military members in Ukraine.
"Ohio has a strong Ukrainian community, and we stand behind them and their families overseas."

Russia has also intensified attacks along Ukraine's eastern border.
